intro: Stewartia nanlingensis, commonly known as the Nanling Stewartia, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It is a deciduous tree belonging to the Theaceae family, characterized by its ornamental foliage and showy flowers. The plant features elliptical leaves that turn yellow in autumn and produces cup-shaped inflorescences with white to pale yellow petals. Its growth habit is slow, making it a prized specimen in botanical gardens and conservation efforts. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
